contextId.information: "Timothy. We are servants of Christ Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Paul is talking about his time in prison. AT: "that the things I suffered because I was put into prison for preaching about Jesus" ([[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The word "fruit" here refers to the good results of Paul's work. AT: "that means I will be able to work and my work will produce good results" or "then I will have more chances to encourage people to believe in Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: that means fruitful labor for me

contextId.information: The cause of the sorrow can be made explicit. AT: "the sorrow of losing him added to the sorrow I already have from being in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Here "these things" refers to Paul's teachings. You can add this alternate translation to the end of the previous sentence. AT: "because these teachings will protect you from those who teach what is not true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: These things will keep you safe

contextId.information: The word "now" emphasizes how Paul has changed since he quit being a Pharisee and became a believer in Christ. AT: "now that I have trusted in Christ, I count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Paul means plenty of the things that he needs for himself. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
